Column Comment.0: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: DEPTH OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the depth or interval.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of a specificsub-interval being described (which is the smallest/thinnest rock unit in which thelithology is being recorded).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: original units of measure used forthe depth measurement.
Column Comment.6: CYCLE BED: Interpreted to be part of a depositional sequence(e.g.Bouma B). Asequence of beds or related processes and conditions, repeated in the same orderthat is recorded in a sedimentary deposit.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: NO DATA DESCRIPTION: Type of reason why no data/lithologic description ispresent for the interval, like lost core or no sample data available for the interval.
Column Comment.10: PARENT DEPTH OBSERVATION NUMBER: identifier for the depth interval that thisone is a parent of.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: PREFERRED INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that this is the preferred version ofan interval. All data associated with this interval is also the preferred version.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SAMPLE ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the sample used to describe thelithologic interval.
Column Comment.15: SAMPLE QUALITY: Quality describing the sample obtained from the interval (e.g.,poor, good, excellent, etc.).
Column Comment.16: STRUCTURE TYPE: Type of sedimentary or other rock structure occurring in thelithologic interval being described (e.g., cross-stratification, mud cracks, ripple marks,etc.). The rock structure may be non-sedimentary, such as contorted bedding or faultzone.
Column Comment.17: THIN BED INDICATOR: Y(es) or N(o) indicating if the described interval containsthinner rock intervals. For example, a lithologic interval may be comprised ofinterbedded shale and sandstone setting the thin bed indicator to Y(es).
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of a specific sub-intervalbeing described (which is the smallest/thinnest rock unit in which the lithology isbeing recorded).
Column Comment.19: TOP DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: original units of measure used forthe depth measurement.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
